channel.title: Cheap but effective gaming laptop
channel.description: So currently my sister is in Europe, she will be returning on the 3rd but i want to have a present waiting for her. I've been thinking about gifts which she would need, i was thinking Sims 3 because she is in love with the game but doesn't have a copy but that seems thoughtless. So then my next thought was a laptop which will run Sims without lagging, and this is where i need help. I don't want to spend over $400 on the laptop and it needs to have graphics suitable for Sims 3. What brand/type of laptop would you suggest?

item.title: Cheap but effective gaming laptop
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Well maybe I’m wrong. From what I’ve seen though quite a few laptops at that price point are still only embedded graphics.

Read full topic

item.title: Cheap but effective gaming laptop
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:12, topic:532121”]$400 is way too low. At that price point you’re looking at casual use such as web browsing, email, and word processing.
Even the laptops at the $800 - $1000 price point probably aren’t so great for gaming.[/quote]
You can easily get a decent laptop with 700$ which runs this generations games with around 40 FPS.

Read full topic

$400 is way too low. At that price point you’re looking at casual use such as web browsing, email, and word processing.

item.title: Cheap but effective gaming laptop
item.dc:creator: @chillwitm888 chillwitm888
item.description:
@chillwitm888 wrote:

I don’t like HP but the offered graphics are pretty decent for the price
heres a asus alt:

amazon.com

Amazon.com: ASUS 11-Inch Q200E Laptop [OLD VERSION]: Computers & Accessories

Shop the Windows Store for the full selection of Windows 8 PCs


its small but the cpu is pretty okay, it can run some modern games at med to high with somewhat playable frames (meh integrated gfx but intel hd 4000 is fairly decent, not the best but they are fine)
http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16834131511 - samsung
http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16834231079 - asus

for an actual gaming laptop you are going to have to spend 500$+

newegg.com

Lenovo Laptop G505s (59378837) AMD A8-Series A8-5550M (2.10 GHz)...

Buy Lenovo Laptop G505s (59378837) AMD A8-Series A8-5550M (2.10 GHz) 4 GB Memory 500 GB HDD AMD Radeon HD 8570M 15.6" Windows 8 with fast shipping and top-rated customer service. Once you know, you Newegg!


cheapest one with a dedicated card around 530$

Read full topic

item.title: Cheap but effective gaming laptop
item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

I don’t specifically want a gaming laptop, i want a laptop suitable for playing Sims and i know it is possible because my sister already had a laptop which could until she broke it.

Read full topic

item.title: Cheap but effective gaming laptop
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:5, topic:532121”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=650913.msg4367502#msg4367502 date=1379964376]
Something like this would do the trick

http://www.bestbuy.com/site/HP+-+Pavilion+17.3%26%2334%3B+Laptop+-+4GB+Memory+-+750GB+Hard+Drive+-+Anodized+Silver/1739112.p?id=1219062510621&skuId=1739112

keep in mind that system requirements are stating 2.0-2.4ghz for the cpu for sims 3 but I’m sure this could handle it on minimum at least.
[/quote]
Integrated graphics card is a big NO when you want a gaming laptop.[/quote]obviously :palm:

Again, you won’t be able to get a gaming laptop for $400

Read full topic
